content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>California Environmental Public Tracking Network</origin> <pubdate>20120912</pubdate> <title>Heat-related deaths among California residents, May-September, 2000-2009.</title> <onlink>http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=863</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This dataset contains counts, rates, and confidence intervals of heat-related deaths among California residents for the years 2000-2009.  These data are stratified by year, age group, race/ethnicity and gender. Crude and age-adjusted rates and confidence intervals are included.</abstract> <purpose>To provide data on the California Environmental Public Health Tracking Network consistent with the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network. The guidance for creating heat-related Nationally Consistent Data and Measures (NCDMs) were developed by funded tracking states.</purpose> <supplinf>Data has been de-identified to protect patient confidentiality.  Heat-related deaths are selected based on cause of death (including underlying and immediate, intermediate, and contributing causes) coding: http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=896#heat_classification.  The California EPHT Program receives calendar year vital records Multiple Cause of Death files (MCOD) from the state's Center for Health Statistics (CHS). These files were created by the National Center for Health Statistics. Each record may include up to 20 causes of death derived from California death certificates. All causes of death are coded according to the International Classification of Diseases version 10. Further information on the California Center for Health Statistics and their available data is located at: http://www.cdph.ca.gov/data/dataresources/requests/Pages/VitalStatisticsBirthDeathFetalDeathMarriageData.aspx.  </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20120913</caldate> <time/> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Publication Date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-124.5</westbc> <eastbc>-114.1</eastbc> <northbc>42.0</northbc> <southbc>32.5</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ICD-10-CM</themekt> <themekey>Heat stroke and sunstroke: T67.0, heat syncope: T67.1, heat cramps: T67.2, heat exhaustion from water depletion: T67.3, heat exhaustion from salt depletion: T67.4, heat exhaustion, unspecified: T67.5, heat fatigue, transient: T67.6, heat edema: T67.7, other specified heat effects: T67.8, unspecified effects of heat and light: T67.9, exposure to excessive natural heat: X30.</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>FIPS 5-2 (State)</placekt> <placekey>California, CA, 06</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst> Restricted (secure) data will only be released to external users after the California EPHT Program and representatives from OSHPD have reviewed the request.  The request must include an Application for Release of Restricted Data along with the Data Use Agreement and, if deemed necessary, a research protocol and proof of approval by or exemption from an Institutional Review Board (IRB) formed and maintained in accordance with the U.S. Dept. of Health and Human Services Code of Federal Regulations for Protection of Human Subjects (45 CFR 46, revised March 8, 1983).  The California Committee for the Protection of Human Subjects serves as the institutional review board (IRB) for the California Health and Human Services Agency.  Information is available at:  http://www.oshpd.ca.gov/boards/cphs/. Users of secure vital records for research purposes must also obtain approval from the California Department of Public Health Vital Statistics Advisory Committee (VSAC): http://www.cdph.ca.gov/services/boards/Pages/VSAC.aspx. </accconst> <useconst> This information is provided by the California Environmental Health Tracking Program (CEHTP) and the California Center for Health Statistics in the California Department of Public Health.  Efforts have been made to assure the accuracy of the data.  However, no responsibility is assumed by CEHTP or CHS related to materials or how they are represented by those who access this information.  All users must read and fully comprehend metadata prior to data use. Data may only be used in the manner specified in the data request proposal.  Data will not be released, furnished, disclosed, published or otherwise disseminated to any person (except for employees under supervision of data requestor, who has agreed in writing to comply with these conditions), unless the data has been aggregated and all cell sizes smaller than 5 are suppressed.    Data may only be used in the manner specified in the data request proposal.  Data will not be released, furnished, disclosed, published or otherwise disseminated to any person (except for employees under supervision of data requestor, who has agreed in writing to comply with these conditions), unless the data has been aggregated and all cell sizes less than 5 are suppressed.     </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <secinfo> <secsys>None</secsys> <secclass>Restricted</secclass> <sechandl>Restricted data released to an external partner may not be disseminated or distributed.</sechandl> </secinfo> <native>SAS 9.3 </native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>N/A</logic> <complete>These data include death records of individuals who residing in California.  These data are based on cause of death codes (ICD-10-CM).</complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc> Vital Statistics Data files are compiled from the information reported on death certificates, including detailed demographic information related to the decedent, as well as medical data related to the vital event.  Each year, CEHTP obtains the MCOD dataset from CHS and creates datasets to  be used for public health surveillance while maintaining confidentiality.    This dataset on the CEHTP portal includes deaths due to heat for May-September for the years 2000-2009.  Each event is identified by looking at cause of death (underlying, intermediate, etc.) based on the International Classification of Disease, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM).  A diagnostic ICD-10-CM code of T67.X or X30 indicates the underlying or contributing cause of death was heat.  Counts, rates, and confidence intervals were calculated by age-group, gender, and race/ethnicity.To calculate rates, we use population data from the California Department of Finance (DOF).  DOF uses year 2000 population data collected by the U.S. Census Bureau and takes into account survival rates, migration patterns, and fertility rates for California to project the California population by county, race/ethnicity, age, and gender for 2000-2050 (State of California, Department of Finance, Population Projections for California and Its Counties 2000-2050, Sacramento, California, July 2007).  Confidence intervals for rates of hospitalizations and ED visits are calculated using the Tiwari, Clegg, and Zou (Methods in Medical Research, 2006; 15:547-569). For more information on how the data is calculated and accompanying limitations, see the methods section:   http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=896. </procdesc> <procdate>20120913</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>This data contains the following fields: Cnty_FIPS  Start_Date  End_Date    Measure_ID   Measure_VA   Case counts are aggregated for May-September and calculated by year, age group, race/ethnicity and gender. </eaover> <eadetcit/> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc/> <distliab>Persons or entities given access to restricted data are liable for compliance with conditions set forth in the data use agreement.  Disciplinary action will be incurred for non-compliance or violation of data use agreements. </distliab> <custom> For access to restricted or secure data please see Access contraints section for release of restricted data. </custom> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20120913</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>EPHTN Tracking Network Profile Version 1.2</metstdn> <metac>None</metac> <metuc>None</metuc> </metainfo> </metadata>
